case_title: MALIK MEHBOOB AND OTHERS vs BACHA GUL
complaint_summary: On 19-2-64, the accused allegedly raided the complainant's village, stole 60 sheep, and opened fire on pursuers, killing Samandar and injuring Nazar Gal and Maroof.
investigation_summary: The case was investigated by Tahsildar Chaman. Injured were treated at Civil Hospital Gulistan and later transferred to Civil Hospital Quetta. Accused fled to Afghanistan and returned after permission from authorities.
judgment_summary: The tribunal convicted Malik Mahboob, Muhammad Sadiq, Kameen, and Bhang under sections 302/307 PPC and section 10 of the Quetta-Kalat Ordinance. Sentences were later modified to 10 years R.I. each under section 302 PPC, with fines. Convictions under section 307 PPC were set aside.
punishment: 10 years R.I. each under section 302 PPC, fine of Rs. 2,000 each or 2 years R.I. in default. Compensation of Rs. 3,000 to heirs of Samandar, Rs. 1,000 each to Nazar Gul and Maroof.
Decision_or_verdict: Conviction under section 302 PPC upheld; convictions under section 307 PPC set aside.
legal_arguments: Jurisdiction of the tribunal questioned but found valid under section 3 PPC.
Accused claimed lack of opportunity for defense; tribunal records refuted this.
Non-participation of one tribunal member argued; verdict upheld due to majority compliance under section 9(2)(a) of Quetta-Kalat Ordinance.

witness_statement.Nazar Gul: Injured during the raid and shooting.
witness_statement.Maroof: Injured during the raid and shooting.

words_and_phrases.Raid: An attack or incursion into a territory.
words_and_phrases.Peace Securities: Legal requirement to ensure good behavior.

summary_vector_notes: Conviction modified to 10 years R.I. under section 302 PPC; peace securities ordered; jurisdiction and defense objections dismissed.
